Subject: FW: Weekend Events.........
Summary: The email discusses a technical issue in the risk management system where Martin Cuilla's VaR (Value at Risk) is not being accurately captured due to problems with curve mapping. The sender, Bharat Khanna, outlines the steps taken over the weekend by team members to resolve the issue, including adjustments in Risktrac and OMICRON, but the problem persists. The email emphasizes the urgency to address this issue, particularly as Cuilla's performance is being monitored by Lavorato. Kam Keiser is enlisted to help in finding a long-term solution and improving the front-end mapping process.

Subject: Re: Upstream GRM Transactions
Summary: The email discusses updates on various transaction pipelines within Enron, including the status of negotiations with Hallwood, Nuevo, Chesapeake, and Benton. It mentions the expected signing of a CA with Hallwood, progress with Nuevo's due diligence, and the ongoing wait for information from Chesapeake. Additionally, there's a potential new transaction involving a VPP for which equity participation in an SPV is being considered.

Subject: Telephone Interview with Ming Sit
Summary: Shirley Crenshaw schedules a telephone interview with Ming Sit for Tuesday, May 23rd at 12:30 PM Houston time in conference room EB19C2, with details on who will initiate the call.

Subject: Free Shipping Ends December 4--Shop Today
Summary: The email from Amazon.com's Holiday Team reminds customers that the free shipping offer ends on December 4. It encourages shopping for holiday gifts with discounts on various products, and provides links to Amazon.com's deals and gift store. The email also includes an unsubscribe link for those who no longer wish to receive such communications.
Mike Carson is inquiring about availability for a golf game on either Saturday or Sunday.

Subject: Price Reservations for 12 May RTM and 13 May DAM
Summary: The NYISO is reserving hours in the real-time market on 12 May and verifying prices in the Day-Ahead market on 13 May. The reservation details are provided for external proxy buses PJM, OH, HQ, and NE.
Ben Rogers has sent a draft presentation on NewCo's trading, risk management, and backoffice operations to Jim. The document is nearly complete, with only the last page still under development.

Subject: Re: deal 495264
Summary: Kate Symes is inquiring about a discrepancy in the total MW shown by Amerex (30400) and Enron's records (24800) for deal 495264, seeking clarification on which is correct.

Subject: New Book
Summary: Eric Bass from Enron is requesting the necessary documentation to set up a new gas firm book.

Subject: Today's GE Conference Call
Summary: The email inquires about the rescheduling of today's GE conference call, referencing a discussion from a previous call.

Subject: Re:
Summary: Jeff Dasovich from Enron is responding to an unspecified offer, seeking clarification. He mentions PG&E's desire for funding to build transmission infrastructure, which he believes could negatively impact TW (presumably Texas Wireless, a natural gas pipeline company). He emphasizes the urgency for a meeting to address this issue.

Subject: Deal 628466
Summary: Chris Germany from Enron has updated the pipeline and meter for deal 628466, transferring it from NFUL #7126 to TRCO #7126.

Subject: RE:
Summary: Carmine Giammarino from Prebon initiates contact to re-establish gas daily trading, expressing interest in discussing markets with Mike Grigsby, who is involved in making markets for California online. Mike responds, offering the contact details of Randy Gay and Frank Ermis for such discussions.

Subject:
Price Reservations 19 May 2001 Real-Time Market and 20 May 2001
 Day-Ahead Market
Summary: The New York Independent System Operator (NYISO) is reserving hours in the Real-Time Market on May 19 and specific hours in the Day-Ahead Market on May 20 to verify prices in accordance with ECA20001006B. The reserved hours are for PJM, Ontario Hub (OH), Hydro-Québec (HQ), and New England (NE). Prices in the Day-Ahead Market for May 20 are confirmed as correct.

Subject: Re: Strictly confidential
Summary: Michelle Cash responds to David Oxley's inquiry about Mike McCall's employment terms, stating that McCall is not under a current employment agreement and no further details about salary or options are available. Oxley had previously sent a draft agreement for McCall on December 2, 1999, and is now seeking advice on potential termination terms.

Subject: Travel
Summary: The sender is planning to travel to Sao Paulo next Tuesday, arriving Monday night and leaving Wednesday morning. The purpose of the visit is to meet with Andrea Bertone to discuss physical and financial trading in Brazil, as well as to set up meetings with the commercial group for alternative deal structures on certain transactions. The sender requests confirmation of availability and time blocking for these discussions, excluding the chief counsel meeting.

Subject: Re: New Power Invoice
Summary: Mary Ellenberger is forwarding a request related to a power invoice to Darla Saruicer, who is a customer representative for The New Power. This suggests a financial matter concerning invoices or billing.

Subject: Confidence
Summary: Georgia Matula, an employee from the Data Management department in EES, expresses her continued loyalty and pride in working for Enron despite past layoff and return. She acknowledges the company's ethical standards and offers prayers and encouragement during a challenging time.

Whittney Skinner, a prospective summer intern, informs that she needs to return to Norman by July 20 due to her sorority president obligations at OU. She is available from May 14 to July 20 and seeks confirmation if this schedule aligns with the 12-week summer analyst program. She expresses a desire to participate in the program if accommodated.

To:
j.beyer@enron.com, childress.alan@enron.com, daniel.falcone@enron.com, 
	mark.friedman@enron.com, richard.hanagriff@enron.com, 
	omar.hasan@enron.com, steve.jacobellis@enron.com, 
	gary.justice@enron.com, nat.kreamer@enron.com,

Subject: Link to Game Lines
Summary: The email provides a link to game lines for the Sheridan football games on the USA Today website, with instructions on how to navigate to the relevant section. It appears to be an external communication intended for recipients interested in sports betting information.

Subject: Give The Gift Of Global Intelligence.  Get The Agenda.
Summary: The email is from the Financial Times, promoting a holiday gift subscription offer for their newspaper. The sender, Stuart Arnold, encourages recipients to give a one-year subscription to a friend at a special holiday rate, including a free 2002 Financial Times Desk Diary. The offer expires on January 31, 2002, but gifts must be given by December 21, 2001, to start in early January. The email also provides an unsubscribe option for those who no longer wish to receive communications from the Financial Times.

Subject: Re: 2000 Plan Allocations and January Allocations
Summary: Daren Farmer reports on the allocation of resources for the 2000 plan, specifying that 15% of the allocation is for Gas Network Services, 84% for Gas Network Trading, and 1% for Gas Network Development. The time spent on Project Sally involved assessing employee requirements for Trading Support functions and reviewing a deal memorandum.

Subject: LV Cogen QF agreement.
Summary: The email discusses the power sale agreement between LV Cogen, a 50 MW PURPA Qualifying Facility in North Las Vegas, and Nevada Power Company. LV Cogen sells 45 MW to NPC during specific months, with EPMI marketing the excess output. EPMI purchases transmission from NPC and sells power at Mead or Palo Verde, depending on congestion, with peak hour production at 50 MW and total daily output at 1200 Mw.

To:
thomas.martin@enron.com, jim.schwieger@enron.com, greg.mcclendon@enron.com, 
	james.mckay@enron.com, elsa.villarreal@enron.com, 
	daren.farmer@enron.com, carey.metz@enron.com, 
	stacey.neuweiler@enron.com, lauri.allen@enron.com,

Subject: Enron Messenging Board
Summary: Ina Rangel is requesting feedback from colleagues on the Enron Messenging Board system to determine its permanence, based on user satisfaction. Laura Harder forwards the request to Airam Arteaga, Amanda Huble, and Kimberly Brown, asking them to gather input from traders.

Subject: Natural Gas Futures Continue Higher on Short-Covering
Summary: The email discusses natural gas futures and prices, presenting data on physical natural gas prices across various regions in North America and futures prices for different months. It also includes information on risk management tools and services for energy enterprises, such as e-Acumen, NUCLEUS Software, and CAMINUS. The email does not contain any personal or HR-related content, financial transactions, external communications, or public relations information.

Subject: Mike Bryant-out of office
Summary: Mike Bryant is scheduled to be out of the office for an appointment on January 18, 2001, from 5:00 PM to 6:00 PM Central Standard Time. The Outlook Migration Team is designated as the chairperson for this calendar entry.

Subject: Re: Equistar Buybacks
Summary: The email discusses the validation of a single "Buyback" ticket (246408) for Meter #1373, clarifying that an older ticket (156342) was used for setting up Equistar Buyback across multiple meters. The email explains the historical context of this setup from April 2000, retroactive to January 1999, and confirms that only one buyback ticket should exist for each company, either on HPL or ENA, with ENA activity kept separate.

Subject: Upcoming Energy Conference - Kaminski Requirements
Summary: Shirley Crenshaw is requested to send a PR photo, handouts, and Mr. Kaminski's flight itinerary for an upcoming Energy Conference in Miami. The coordinator, Dawn Scovill, needs these details to finalize room setups and conference book.

Subject: Deal # 508797
Summary: Melissa Murphy from Enron has informed that a termination letter for deal #508797.01 has been fully executed, and Holli Krebs is aware of the impending termination. She is seeking confirmation on whether the deal should be officially closed.

Subject: EB2132 - Jill (Team Leadership Mtg.)
Summary: Stacey W. White has scheduled a team leadership meeting for Jill on January 26, 2001, from 3:30 PM to 4:30 PM Central Standard Time. Stacey is designated as the chairperson for this internal company event.

Subject: Latin American Energy Crisis Conference Call
Summary: The email announces a conference call by UBS Warburg Analysts on the Latin American Energy Crisis, focusing on its impact on major foreign players like ENE, AES, DUKE, Endesa, EdP, Iberdrola, and Tracetebel. The call is scheduled for tomorrow at 10:00 am CST. It also includes a notice regarding entry of orders and instructions for PaineWebber accounts, stating that such communications should not be sent via email.

Subject: Alaska cruise/gift for Mom's retirement
Summary: Debbie is seeking feedback on a proposed Alaska cruise vacation for her parents, including details on pricing, itinerary, and a potential land package for McKinley and Denali. She has made a courtesy reservation for the July cruise with an ocean view room and is considering input before finalizing the decision. The trip would cost each person $1300, with a $300 deposit required.

Subject: 2000 Peaker Turbine Nominal Output
Summary: Richard Broussard from Enron provides nominal outputs for 2000 peaker turbines at ISO under specified conditions, detailing units, types, power (kW), and heat rate (Btu/kWh LHV) for Wheatland and Lincoln Center sites. He notes that Gleason's nominal values are unavailable and will require corrected numbers.

Subject: Re: LIH
Summary: Sheryl Gussett, from Bracewell & Patterson, inquires about attending Ted's dinner party on Saturday, mentioning a coincidental client update, and confirms attendance around 5:30 PM.
Matthew Lenhart, from enron.com, is inquiring about plans to go out for golf this weekend.
Delainey and Shankman discuss coordinating a meeting to reach consensus on the operation of the east desk, with potential plans for replicating the process for other desks.

Subject: CSC MRS Presentation
Summary: The email contains a presentation from the MRS meeting held the previous day, focusing on calculated TTC limits between zones for the on-peak summer base case. The sender, Kenneth A. Donohoo, is the Manager of System Planning at Technical Operations at ERCOT.

Subject: ENA/Devon
Summary: Shonnie Daniel from Enron has sent a draft of a Gathering Agreement between ENA and Lost Creek for review, pertaining to the Devon Beaver Creek transaction. Comments and feedback are requested.

Subject: FW: PG&E
Summary: The email discusses a potential strategy to offer El Paso capacity to PG&E during their bankruptcy settlement negotiations, aiming to reduce Enron's claim against PG&E. Barry Tycholiz mentions that PG&E is hesitant about the El Paso pipe due to flow risk but could potentially consider it if delivery reliability improves. He suggests that Leslie Lawner or Michael discuss logistics further.

Subject: Name Overlay 0426
Summary: Cheryl Johnson from Enron informs about a name overlay in GCP, replacing Vopak USA Inc. with Van Waters & Rogers Inc., CP ID 9784. Shortname changes are scheduled for this morning, and records will be inactivated on Tuesday, 05/01/01, late afternoon.

Subject: HPL Meter
Summary: Judy Townsend from Enron receives a forward from lamoss at Duke-Energy regarding the HPL Meter. The email details extensive work required before custody transfer measurement can be performed, including valve overhauls, meter tube inspections, transmitter replacements, and RTU board furnishing. The estimated time for re-working the station controls and associated components is 1.5 months.

Subject: Retail Deal with Food Industry Alliance Closed
Summary: An aggregation deal with the New York Food Industry Alliance (FIA) has been closed, expected to generate a margin of at least $1.3 million. The deal was initiated by Howard Fromer, who sublet office space from FIA in Albany, and was finalized with assistance from EES and the FIA President, resolving issues raised by FIA members. The physical presence in FIA's office suite was leveraged as a persuasive factor against a competitor's offer.

Subject: Markup of Power Sale Agreement
Summary: John Llodra has forwarded a marked-up draft Power Sale Agreement with New Hampshire Electric Coop to Elizabeth Sager and Paul Racicot. The markup includes important language changes in Article 14.2 regarding Installed Capability credit during Seabrook outages. Comments are needed by noon Eastern Time on March 13th, with a request to discuss via phone at 978-449-9936.

Subject: Industry Standard's Net Returns speakers
Summary: The email chain discusses an invitation for Enron to participate in speaking at the Industry Standard's Net Returns conference in Aspen. The conference features a list of high-profile speakers from various companies, and the organizer requests a decision by Thursday. Mike McConnell informs that he is unavailable, suggesting Jeff consider it, while Stephen Horn proposes to RSVP for the speaking slot and hold it for McMahon if interested.

Subject: RE: Bankers Trust/Deutsche Bank
Summary: Tana Jones from Enron is updating a group of recipients about the status of Bankers Trust trades with Deutsche Bank. Deutsche Bank is hesitant about handling online trades and is considering a full novation after further consideration, expected within a week. Jones advises to hold the Bankers Trust financial trades and master until further updates.
The email from john.lavorato@enron.com instructs to "lease the EOTT space," indicating a logistical or operational matter related to property or facility management.

Subject: ILA: Initiating Coverage of a Pure-Play Energy Merchant
Summary: This email from Raymond C. Niles of Salomon Smith Barney announces the initiation of coverage for Aquila, Inc. by ILA (Investment Liaison Associates) with a Buy rating and a 12-month price target of $44. Aquila is described as a pure-play Energy Merchant with strong trading and risk management skills in growing energy commodity markets. The email also includes projections for ILA's growth and a comparison of its PEG ratio to industry peers. Attachments are provided for additional information.

Subject: Work Request for Ongoing Power Banding
Summary: Steve Walker from CSC is forwarding a work request for ongoing power banding pricing to Enron colleagues, including Chris Stokely, Richard Miller, and others. The request is attached as Power Banding - Ongoing.doc, and Steve plans to discuss the Historical Work Request with Chris on Monday.

Subject: Start Date: 12/22/01; HourAhead hour: 14;
Summary: This email pertains to the scheduling and parsing of files for the ISO, specifically mentioning the start date of 12/22/01 and the hour ahead as 14, with no ancillary schedules awarded and no variances detected. It also references a parsing log message file.

Subject: Re: APS/Pinnacle West
Summary: The email thread discusses the naming discrepancies between APS and Pinnacle West in trade confirmations. Stephanie Piwetz clarifies with DeeDee from Pinnacle West that all deals should be under Pinnacle West, except for Bloomberg transactions which should retain APS. Kate Symes acknowledges the changes and seeks confirmation on whether APS has fully switched to Pinnacle West and if there will be issues with old counterparty names in future deals.

Subject: FW: Fw: Job Interview Skills
Summary: Donna Mullen forwards an anecdote about job interview skills, emphasizing the importance of tactful observation, to multiple internal recipients including colleagues and HR-related contacts.

Subject: Re: [smu-betas] Dent's wrath
Summary: The email is a personal message from samuraimai, expressing dissatisfaction with a sports outcome and sharing plans to demolish a tower in Austin. The sender also invites others to a future homecoming BETA reunion, reminiscing about a past event where the BETA tent had the largest crowd. The tone is informal and non-work-related.

Subject: Weekend Outage Report for 10-19-01 through 10-21-01
Summary: This email details scheduled system outages affecting various Enron systems and facilities from October 19 to October 21, 2001. The outages include power outages in Enron Center South for repairs, decommissioning of the PROWLER firewall, migration of 3AC to Corp IP space, changes in internal routing for EBS integration, and maintenance for SAP, EI Notes Server, and other systems. Specific details about the duration, impacted environments, purposes, and contacts for each outage are provided.

Subject: Document Retention
Summary: This email from jr..legal@enron.com pertains to document retention due to ongoing investigations and lawsuits, as mandated by a Bankruptcy Court Order. It lists various subjects of subpoenas and document requests, including special purpose entities, LJM entities, accounting records, structured finance documents, and communications with regulatory bodies, analysts, investors, and credit rating agencies. The email emphasizes the need to retain all relevant documents until these matters are concluded.

Subject: RE:
Summary: Mike Marcoux, a Mechanical Design Engineer at Boston Engineering, is seeking a new roommate starting July due to his current roommate's plan to move in with a partner. He describes his current apartment in West Newton, including its features and monthly rent of $1450, and invites interested parties or those who know of potential roommates to contact him.

Subject: Site Visits - Peakers
Summary: Southern Energy, Inc. is requesting specific dates, Oct 16th for Lincoln Energy and Oct 17th for Wheatland, for a site visit by a due diligence team of approximately 10 members. They will provide a list of team members' names, titles, and affiliations upon confirmation. Contact information for inquiries is provided.

Subject: Re: WestLB
Summary: Kay Mann is requesting a list of all equipment purchased through WestLB for refinancing purposes, currently aware of the LM deal with GE (one executed change order, four pending) and the ABB transformer deal (one change order pending). Kay asks others to provide information on any additional equipment purchased through WestLB.

Subject: Peaker projects
Summary: Jinsung Myung is requesting Ben to facilitate access to LiveLink by providing Carolyn with Ben's NT Log-on ID, email address, and extension number, and by submitting a security request for LiveLink. The access is needed urgently, ideally by the end of the day.

Subject: Our meeting
Summary: David Dupre, an applicant, expresses interest in joining a group at Enron, highlighting his skills in Excel, Access, Bloomberg, and quantitative analysis, particularly in meteorology. He emphasizes his ability to gather vital market information and contribute significantly to the group's success, mentioning his experience from Enron and CIBC World Markets. He requests a meeting with select group members.

Subject: Stella Chan /Project Summer transfers
Summary: The email discusses the transfer of Stella Chan, a Director-level expat from the SK Enron JV in Korea, to the Corporate Public Affairs group under Harry Kingerski. The transfer is supported due to her contract's end date and her early repatriation desire. A potential replacement, Waymon Votaw, is identified for her role in the Southern Cone group. The email seeks approval for the transfer and replacement process.

Subject: Wheeling Pitt consignment
Summary: Kay Mann from Enron is informing about a potential credit issue with a Wheeling Pitt consignment, requesting patience for further updates, and noting that the client is satisfied with the service.

The email discusses ongoing considerations regarding a gas accord, with the sender's company, PG&E, yet to finalize its stance. The sender advises the recipient, Jeff, to persist in pursuing business opportunities within his own company despite previous setbacks, suggesting he should escalate his efforts to higher management levels.

Subject: Energy Company Values Sink In Response to Changing Times
Summary: Constellation Energy's stock value dropped 11% due to revised earnings projections, shelved company split plans, and termination of a partnership with Goldman Sachs. The company will pay Goldman Sachs $355 million to terminate their power-marketing agreement. This shift in strategy is driven by falling energy prices, changing California power crisis dynamics, and weak economic conditions. Other energy companies like Allegheny Energy are also adjusting their strategies due to similar market pressures.

Subject: Enron Noncompetition Agreement; Important Notice
Summary: Robert is circulating a Memorandum from Jim Derrick to all Enron Attorneys regarding the obligations of Enron Corp., Enron Energy Services, LLC, and their controlled affiliates under a recently executed Noncompetition Agreement. The email emphasizes the confidential nature of the agreement and its transactions, instructing recipients to treat the information with strict confidence. The attachments are also being sent to the Enron Corporate Development Group and members of the Enron Executive Committee.
Chris Dorland is requesting a brief meeting with the recipient, Jon, during the afternoon for an unspecified matter.

Subject: Re: Gatherco
Summary: The email discusses the availability of team members for a project or task, specifically mentioning Gloria and Victor's status, with Victor being unavailable for the rest of the week.

Subject:
Steve Kean's speech on California, Madrid 12/6; EURELECTRIC mission
 to the USA: Report
Summary: Peter Styles from Enron forwards a draft report from EURELECTRIC's study visit to California, emphasizing key issues for Steve Kean's upcoming speech in Madrid on 12/6. The report focuses on wholesale and retail market decoupling, guaranteed benefits for smaller consumers, and insufficient demand-side and generation investment signals. Styles requests input from Alfredo, Teun, Paul, and another Paul by week's end to tailor the presentation for relevant European markets.

Subject:
September 20, 2000 Finance/Origination M&A Legal Group Staff
 Meeting
Summary: The Finance/Origination M&A Legal Group is scheduling a staff meeting for September 20, 2000, at 10:00 a.m. in EB32C2. For those attending remotely, the teleconference details are provided, including the call-in number, access code, and host code. The email is sent by Julia Murray and Sheila Tweed from Enron North America Corp.

Subject: Upcoming Lunch
Summary: Carol is inviting input on whether to invite Nidia Mendoza and Cathy Tudon to a training session on Friday, covering basic concepts of ISDA and CSA Schedules and confirmations.

Subject: Re: Merry Xmas and a Happy New Year!
Summary: Vince Kaminski responds to Les Clewlow's holiday greeting, wishing him and his family a Merry Christmas.

Subject: New Position (Sam Smith)
Summary: Mike Roberts proposes creating a new position, Staff Specialist, within the research group for Sam Smith. The role involves technical duties such as quality control of weather forecasting procedures, preparing the research Intelligence newsletter, and managing operational tasks like Morning Report assembly and hurricane season surveillance. The position is to be made retroactive to January 1st of the current year.

Subject: syncretic: M-W's Word of the Day
Summary: This email is a daily Word of the Day newsletter from Merriam-Webster, Inc., featuring the word "syncretic" along with its definition, example sentence, etymology, and instructions for subscribing or unsubscribing to the service. It includes contact information for inquiries about subscriptions and the Word of the Day itself.

Subject: Par Forward EOL product
Summary: The email pertains to reviewing and potentially amending the General Terms and Conditions (GTCs) for the Canadian FX product, with a focus on aligning descriptions with "ISDA language." It involves discussions between Sara Shackleton, Stuart, and Carlos regarding form of confirmation and necessary amendments.

Subject: VP
Summary: Mike Grigsby inquires about eligibility for the VP investment program regarding this year's bonus, suggesting to advocate for inclusion if not already granted.

Subject: Guaranty Letter
Summary: Freddy Sanches, Vice President of Economics and Finance at STEAG Power LLC, has sent a guaranty agreement for review to Greg Brazaitis at Enron. The document, HPL GUARANTY.doc, contains revisions that Sanches requests Brazaitis to review and confirm as acceptable.

Subject: Employee Referral Program
Summary: Enron is continuing its Employee Referral Program, offering a $5000 reward for successful hires. The program will run until further notice. Employees are instructed to visit the HR website for a complete list of hot jobs and to submit referrals via the Employee Referral form, adhering to the eligibility guidelines and procedures outlined in the attached policy. Referrals submitted after February 1st without following the proper ER procedure will not be eligible for bonus payments.

Subject: Re: apb check out
Summary: Kate Symes is informed that Mark has updated the APB check-out period to March 28 to March 31, and she acknowledges this change as acceptable.

Subject: PowerMarketers.com Daily Power Report for 8 March 2001
Summary: The email contains a daily power report from PowerMarketers.com, featuring breaking energy news, industry events, and job opportations in the power sector. It includes links to subscribe for free, register for conferences, and access related resources.

Subject: RE: Form
Summary: Becky Spencer is inquiring about the Credit Review Sheet form that Sara Shackleton mentioned could be obtained from Tom Moran, Veronica Gonzales, or Bjorn Hagelmann. Becky had previously discussed this with Brent Hendry, who needs the form for a similar implementation at his new job.

Subject: Start Date: 4/11/01; HourAhead hour: 8;  <CODESITE>
Summary: This email pertains to the scheduling and parsing of files for the ISO (Independent System Operator) on April 11, 2001, at 8 hours, with no ancillary schedules awarded or variances detected. The log messages indicate the process of parsing a file from O:\Portland\WestDesk\California Scheduling\ISO Final Schedules.

Subject: It's almost time
Summary: This email is from enron.announcements@enron.com, likely an official company channel, announcing a check-in event on Monday, possibly related to employee well-being or attendance.

Subject: houston visit
Summary: The email is a casual exchange between two individuals, discussing a recent trip to Portland and inquiring about the recipient's work in Houston. The sender mentions visiting friends and enjoying the trip, including cheap flights and good weather. The tone is light-hearted and non-work related.

Subject: California Power Markets
Summary: The email contains a forwarded message from Suzanne Nimocks at McKinsey & Company to Steven Kean at Enron, sharing an analysis on the California Power Crisis. The attachment is a PowerPoint presentation (10209 zxd414.ppt). The email discusses the crisis's implications, likely relevant to Enron's business operations and logistics in the power markets.

Subject: NIPSCO Choice
Summary: Doug Kinney from Columbia Energy Group is requesting a price quote for volume requirements under the NIPSCO Choice program, detailing monthly flowing volume needs and peak-day requirements, with the necessary information provided in an attached Excel file.

Subject: RE: ERCOT Counterparties
Summary: The email discusses the sharing of a list of top trading counterparties in ERCOT, with a focus on ensuring all necessary master agreements are in place for power and gas transactions in Texas, as requested by Mike Curry from the power group.

Subject: EES Files
Summary: Kit Blair has prepared EES and PGES files up to March and is ready to send them to the appropriate person at EES upon request.

Subject: RE: Hello!
Summary: The email exchange is between Gerald Nemec and Kevin Jurica, discussing a potential jam session together, possibly at Keneally's. They mention their shared interest in music, with Gerald learning guitar and Kevin playing drums. The conversation is informal and non-work-related.

Subject: Dell Computer - Saved Quote Information
Summary: This email from Dell's pagemaster informs the recipient, Mark E Taylor, about a saved E-Quote for computer equipment at the Dell Online Store. The E-Quote, number E000520807, includes details like the quote name, saved date, expiration date, and description (2x memory 60GB HD). Instructions are provided to retrieve the E-Quote by logging into the Premier page for Enron and selecting it from the list of active E-Quotes.

Subject: ETS and  Corporate Change Control
Summary: The email from center.ets@enron.com details a planned maintenance schedule for the Telephony team, which involves removing a telephone switch from 3AC and migrating phone numbers starting at 6:00 PM on January 28. The maintenance is expected to last approximately one hour, causing brief outages for specific blocks of phone numbers. The impacted ETS users are informed of the changes and provided with contact details for the ETS Solution Centers in Houston and Omaha.

Subject: MG plc's Integration with Enron NetWorks L.P.
Summary: The email contains a PowerPoint presentation detailing the steps required to integrate MG plc into Enron NetWorks L.P., indicating a business operations and logistics focus.

	george.smith@enron.com, daren.farmer@enron.com, pat.clynes@enron.com
Subject: Re: Request for Application Report List
Summary: This email chain discusses a request for a list of application reports from CES systems, specifically for the Altra GMS, to assist with contract management during a transition period. The deadline for submitting the report requirements is adjusted to Thursday, 1/13, with a spreadsheet attached for team members to fill out and return. The focus is on logistics coordination and operational needs within Enron.

Subject: RE: Draft of Organizational Announcement
Summary: The email discusses the formation of a new corporate equity investment unit, Enron Principal Investments, combining existing investment units and the Wholesale Restructuring Group. The unit's strategy involves identifying and managing equity investments across Enron's core businesses. Kevin Garland is appointed as Managing Director, and the unit will report to Greg Whalley, an Enron Policy Committee member.

Subject: Start Date: 10/15/01; HourAhead hour: 15;  <CODESITE>
Summary: This email reports on the start date of October 15, 2001, at hour 15, with no ancillary schedules awarded and no variances detected. It mentions an error while retrieving HourAhead price data, indicating a technical issue in the scheduling process for West Desk, California. The log messages and file paths suggest a focus on operational logistics and data processing within Enron.
This email is a casual, non-work-related message from John Arnold, implying a social debt for dinner.

Subject: presentation next week to Southern Gas Association
Summary: Stephen Burns from Enron has been invited to speak at the Southern Gas Association conference on the topic of pipeline right-of-way, following a previous engagement on fiber optic federal lands ROW. He is seeking approval for his proposed presentation on the impact of fiber ROW issues on pipelines.

Subject: NAES meeting in Barton Creek in Austin
Summary: Steven Kean is scheduling a meeting at Barton Creek in Austin for Laura Houston, with approximately 100 attendees from Amanda's team. The meeting, titled "Regulatory Update," will cover gas and electricity regulatory positions, initiatives, and events relevant to the retail perspective. The presentation will include overheads or slides, requiring notification to Sheila Hatten.

Subject: (no subject)
Summary: Mark Whitt forwarded an email from M.A. Whitt on September 23, 2000, to Gerald Nemec, confirming Huber CIG with an attached document, indicating logistics or operations-related communication within Enron.

Subject: El Paso imbalance
Summary: Pat Clynes from Enron informs about El Paso's plan to return 238,000 mmbtus to HPL at Moss Bluff, starting on October 26. The daily volume details are yet to be provided.

Subject:
Re: "What To Expect In Western Power Markets This Summer"
 Conference and Other Upcoming Events
Summary: Lysa Akin from Enron informs about Mary Hain's resignation and requests her removal from mail lists. The email is a response to a previous message about an upcoming conference on Western power markets organized by Electric Utility Consultants, Inc. (EUCI). The conference aims to discuss various factors influencing power prices and market dynamics in the Western region.

Subject: New Product Version - Daily TFX
Summary: Steve Kirk requests Tony Pryor's immediate review and approval for new product versions related to daily TFX deliveries at Ventura and Demarc. The rate aspect uses existing "R+C" language, and the term "Dly" signifies a daily rollover unless canceled. Steve is available for questions at x7067.

Subject:
Energy: Oil Drilling: SURVEY FINDS PRODUCERS PLAN TO SPEND MORE
 THAN ORIGINALLY PLANNED IN ...
Summary:
Lehman Brothers' mid-year survey of 326 oil and gas producers reveals 
an 18.2% increase in planned 2000 worldwide exploration and production 
expenditures, up from a 10.2% rise anticipated at the year's start. This 
increase is driven by higher natural gas prices and increased cash flow, 
with independent producers showing a 26.1% budget growth, while major oil 
companies plan an 8.8% gain. The survey also highlights significant budget 
revisions in the U.S., Canada, and international markets.

Note: The email content pertains to business operations and logistics within 
the energy sector, focusing on planned expenditures and budget adjustments 
in oil and gas production.

Subject: SUPPLEMENTAL Weekend Outage Report for 5-11-01 through 5-14-01
Summary: This email is a supplemental report detailing system outages from May 11 to May 14, 2001, across various Enron systems and data centers. It outlines scheduled and unscheduled outages, their impacted environments, purposes, and contact information for assistance. The report covers facility operations, messaging, market data, NT, OS/2, other systems, and unify, with specifics on outage times, reasons, and reversion plans.

Subject: ISDA Master Agreement
Summary: Marie Heard, Senior Legal Specialist at Enron North America Corp., is sending a new email due to a previous delivery failure. The email contains a proposed guaranty form from Enron Corp. for ECT Investments, which will only cover amounts above a certain threshold, with Enron awaiting ECT's schedule.

Subject: RE: your nice note
Summary: Jeff and Ben, both Enron employees, exchange personal messages. Jeff thanks Ben for his concern after the 9/11 attacks, sharing his recent family experiences. Ben expresses relief that Jeff wasn't affected and mentions his wife Hillary's narrow escape from the World Trade Center. They plan to meet for a meal, with Ben inviting Jeff to his home. Ben also updates Jeff on his business matters, including interest in a Galle sculpture.

Subject: Armada M700 - Laptop Purchase
Summary: Susan Scott requests Jeff Nguyen to order an Armada M700 laptop, along with two docking stations, a monitor, and a keyboard. Jeff informs Susan that Karon O'Gorman, responsible for purchasing from Omaha and Houston, will handle the order arrangements.

Subject: FW: Huber Docs
Summary: The email pertains to a discussion on the scope of certain documents, specifically drafts, between Gerald Nemec and Barry Tycholiz. They plan to review these documents with actual details, indicating a project or operational matter. Jeffrey T. Hodge is also cc'd in the communication.

Subject: Super-secret Linux
Summary: This email discusses a collaboration between Network Associates and the National Security Agency (NSA) to enhance the security of Linux through a project called Security Enhanced Linux (SELinux). The aim is to protect Linux servers from attacks like "buffer overrun" and "format string" exploits. The modified Linux source code will eventually be released to the open-source community, potentially leading to more secure commercial Linux distributions for enterprise use.

Subject: RE: petition for declaratory statement
Summary: The email discusses a joint petition for a declaratory statement concerning a public utility's eligibility to serve a customer under Section 366.03, Florida Statutes, filed by Gulf Power Company and Enron Compression Services Company. The sender, Gerald Nemec from Enron, is considering approaching WFEC and AEC to discuss this matter and seeks input from Jeff on potential pitfalls. The email also includes a docket number and details about the filing from the FPSC website.

Subject: FW: ENRON CONFIRMATION LETTER - Pool Gas
Summary: Phil DeMoes is forwarding an email from Alan Kilpatrick of Southern Co regarding changes to a confirmation letter, likely related to ongoing negotiations between Enron and Southern Co, focusing on Pool Gas. The email includes redlined versions of the document for review and discussion.

Subject: Protocol link
Summary: The email from Smith L. Day of Enron Power Marketing, Inc. shares a link related to protocols, likely pertaining to business operations or logistics. The link directs to documents concerning drafted COTP protocols on the ERCT website.

Subject: Re: SM134
Summary: Phillip Allen from Enron is discussing a financial model for a project, proposing a 65/35 profit split initially, with adjustments based on construction performance, ranging from 55/45 to 60/40. He suggests a construction agreement with fixed profit or equity incentives tied to meeting budget and schedule targets. He provides a home phone number for further discussion.

Subject:
Re: California Senator Bowen Calls for Electricity Hearing in CA on
 Monday
Summary: Jeff Dasovich from Enron declines to participate in a hearing requested by California Senator Bowen on Monday due to short notice. Enron intends to engage actively in California's electricity process to help find a solution beneficial to all parties.

Subject: Australian PA/ETA
Summary: David Forster is coordinating a roadshow for Paul to start with Australian customers next Tuesday. He requests a review of amendments to the PA and ETA by David Minns, to be ready for Paul by Monday afternoon.

Subject: COI
Summary: The email from david.baumbach@enron.com with the subject "COI" likely pertains to a Conflict of Interest matter, possibly involving financial or legal considerations.

Subject: Ferrell North America
Summary: Mary has received a Subscriber membership application from Ferrell North America, a division of Ferrellgas L.P. based in Houston, and is seeking approval to proceed with their application.

Subject: Re: Henwood query
Summary: The email discusses technical issues related to the EMSS system, a tool used in power trading. Michael Schilmoeller, identified as an expert, provides contact details of colleagues who can assist with specific queries about the system. He also attaches Excel workbooks for reference, detailing query results and supply curve construction, aiming to help resolve the analyst's difficulties in interpreting output results for the Dutch market.

Eduardo Quintana from TGS reports a positive meeting with the US Embassy in Argentina, where they discussed strategies to help TGS with the Argentine National Government, including meetings with Colin Powell and Argentine officials.

Subject:
FW: 5 State Energy Advisors Fired Over Conflicts Ethics: The
 consultants were involved in buying electricity for California from a
 generator whose stock they owned, setting up a clash of official duties,
 personal interests.
Summary: The email discusses the firing of five energy consultants in California due to conflicts of interest. These consultants, including Jeffrey L. Rabin, Daryl Kelleher, and Richard Ferreira, owned stock in energy companies they were contracted to purchase electricity from for the state. This violated state law prohibiting officials from participating in decisions involving personal financial interests. The email also mentions a sixth consultant who resigned and criticism from watchdog groups regarding lack of disclosure and potential insider trading. The state spent over $25 million on consultants with seemingly little attention to routine government ethics laws.

Subject: Re: address
Summary: Sandra Brawner sends New Year greetings to Susan, wishing her well and providing her home and cell phone numbers.

Subject: Citgo Pipeline rupture
Summary: Cheryl Kondo informs that Richard Sanders will replace Kenton Erwin as in-house counsel for the Citgo Pipeline rupture matter. Richard, an Enron North America attorney handling litigation, will attend the June 8 mediation and can be reached at 713-853-5587 for all future inquiries.

The participants confirm the meeting time, location (CR 5C1), and update their calendars accordingly.

Morgan, which is currently on hold as per Jay's instruction, and Dominion, for which credit terms are awaited from the credit department. Subject: Gallup answers
Summary: Susan Scott from Enron reports on the status of the Gallup compressor, which was declared in-service but was immediately taken down due to technical issues. The cause of the vibration and whining noise is unknown, and repairs could take months. The email discusses two PR and economic strategies: either retract the in-service announcement to avoid potential lawsuits and maintain customer trust, or continue with the in-service claim to retain reservation charges, acknowledging the risk of damaging customer relationships and potential legal action. The decision needs to be made promptly to prevent escalating customer relations issues.

Subject: RAC Meeting for May 18th, 2001
Summary: The email discusses a RAC (Risk Assessment Committee) meeting scheduled for May 18, 2001, detailing four new projects added to the hot deals list. These projects include a gas purchase from Norway, a structure credit for Ownes Corning, and acquisition and sale transactions involving Leaf River and Jupiter. Suggested action items involve communicating findings to specific parties and compiling GA comments for the RAC.

Subject: Desert Sky Curtailment April 2002

Bo Thisted alerts Matt to possible 12-hour clock usage causing zero production records. Kurt Anderson requests a call regarding the issue, and Mark Fisher provides a generated spreadsheet detailing problems with time entries, negative durations, and unexplained zero productions, along with a 90.9% data recovery rate.

Subject: EPMI response to FERC investigation--East
Summary: This email from Christi Nicolay at Enron contains EPMI's responses to the FERC investigation regarding discriminatory practices and issues with OATT rules for trading and interconnection activities in the East. The responses are attached, and FERC staff requested similar information from 10 power marketers, intending to use the aggregated data in their report to the Commission by November 1.

Subject: Enron Mentions
Summary: The email discusses various financial and legal issues surrounding Enron, including its tumultuous financial situation, lawsuits, and investigations. Key points include Enron's complex dealings with related entities, potential hidden liabilities, and the impact on its credit rating. The company's former CFO, Andrew Fastow, is implicated in partnership dealings that led to significant losses, prompting his replacement by Jeff McMahon. Enron faces scrutiny from regulators, lawsuits alleging market manipulation, and potential breaches of fiduciary duties regarding employee retirement plans. The company's stock value has plummeted, and it has drawn down a $3 billion credit line to address immediate financial obligations.

Subject: Prudency C
Summary: Kevin Presto proposes using $20 million from the 2001 accrual gas position to address prudency issues in four specific accounts: JEA (Northern Florida) short position, VEPCO market-based call option, MJMUC 40 MW short position, and OPPD 110 MW daily shaped call. Each account faces illiquidity, delivery problems, and inconsistent scheduling flexibility, potentially exposing the company to significant financial risk. Presto deems it prudent to allocate funds from gas accrual gains to mitigate these risks.

Subject: RE: Intra-day call service at PGL
Summary: Richard Tomaski is verifying intra-day call service transactions at PGL with Martin Cuilla, confirming the details of transactions from September 8 to September 13, totaling $20,000 at a rate of $0.10 per unit. Martin agrees with the listed transactions.

Subject: West Books
Summary: Darron Giron provides a list of book names related to West operations, specifying naming conventions for Basis and Gas Daily books, and offers assistance via phone for any queries.

Subject: RE: How's your back???
Summary: The email exchange is between two individuals, Chris Germany and Joni Veselack, discussing personal matters such as pets, hobbies, and travel plans. They also mention their personal lives, including Chris's interest in finding a partner and Joni's plans to get kittens and visit friends. There is no reference to business, operations, finance, legal matters, or external communications.

Subject: Flag Football Schedule
Summary: Brian Hoskins informs the group about the Enron Flag Football schedule, noting a forfeit due to a lack of communication from the previous president. He provides game details, including dates, times, and opponents, and gives directions to Jaycee Park where the games will be held.

Subject: Contract Update
Summary: Tim Belden provides an update on a contract, mentioning that Mike has signed it. Richter, Heizenrader, and Belden are awaiting specific language to address California litigation risk, which they are working on independently. They have been waiting for proposed language and a copy of Enron's corporate bylaws from Michele Cash for a week.

Subject:
To: All Domestic Employees who Participate in the Enron Corp
 Savings Plan
Summary: This email is a reminder for all domestic employees participating in the Enron Corp Savings Plan about upcoming changes on October 26, including the transition to a new administrator, replacement of Vanguard Lifestrategy options with Fidelity Freedom funds, and deadlines for fund transfers, contribution allocation changes, and contribution rate adjustments. Assistance will be available via a dedicated phone line from October 29 to November 19.

Subject:
RE: Monday Morning Meetings - Policy Committee and Office of the
 General Counsel
Summary: The email announces a change in the start time of Monday morning meetings for the Policy Committee and Office of the General Counsel from 11:00 am to 10:00 am CDT. It also informs about the return to meeting in room EB38C2 and adjustments to the meeting schedule due to the Labor Day holiday on September 3.

The email discusses potential financial strategies in response to the U.S. dollar weakening against major currencies, suggesting the consideration of selling long-dated over-the-counter foreign exchange (F/X) or Euro calls, or alternatively, selling calls and buying puts with the proceeds. Subject: Summary of CPUC All-Party Meeting 1/3/01
Summary: This email summarizes a CPUC All-Party Meeting on January 3, 2001, where various parties, including SCE, PG&E, ORA, CIU, California Industrial Users, Reliant, Enron, citizen advocates, and a private attorney, presented their views on the draft final order. Key issues discussed were the end of the rate freeze, recovery of past undercollections, future procurement costs, surcharge adequacy, corporate cost-cutting, revenue bonds, return on equity reduction, energy conservation, and the impact of rate increases on the California economy. The meeting was presided over by ALJ Walwyn and Commissioner Wood.

Subject:
(01-91) Exchange Selects GlobalView Software Inc. c for enymex
 Customer Interface Infrastructure
Summary: The New York Mercantile Exchange has chosen GlobalView Software Inc. to develop the infrastructure for enymex, its e-commerce venture for trading and clearing energy and metals products. GlobalView Software will provide MarketView, a web-enabled product for market information integration, delivery, and display, which will host enymex trading and administration functions. The enymex platform aims to launch in Q2 2001, offering a neutral internet-based trading and clearing solution with counterparty risk management and net margining features.

Subject: Overview of Investor Conference Call
Summary: The email from Enron's chairman provides an overview of a conference call with investors, addressing the company's current situation marked by poor investments in non-core businesses, over-leveraging, related-party transactions, lack of transparency, and financial statement errors. Enron plans to separate its businesses into core, non-core, and businesses under review, with a focus on selling non-core assets to repay debt and reinvest in core businesses. The company aims to maintain its investment-grade credit rating and will file its 10-Q five days late due to ongoing activities. A joint proxy statement/prospectus will be filed with the SEC regarding proposed transactions with Dynegy.

Subject: Organization Changes
Summary: Enron is reorganizing its asset-based businesses into Enron Global Services (EGS) to enhance resource allocation and synergies. This restructuring aims to improve prioritization of business opportunities and management of Enron's global assets, including pipeline, power, and distribution operations. Key personnel have been assigned to lead various business units and support functions within EGS.

Subject: Energy Efficiency, etc. Incentives
Summary: The email discusses a meeting on October 7 to allocate $50 million from AB 970 for energy conservation and demand-side management programs. Brian Smith from EES's Costa Mesa office will attend the meeting following a call with Jeff Dasovich and Bob Frank. The email also mentions Larry Derrett's inquiry about potential new initiatives or federal/state proposals for incentivizing energy efficiency investments, to which Harry Kingerski is compiling a response.

Subject: Re: new email
Summary: Daren Farmer confirms attendance at the office from Friday to Saturday night. The email is informal and appears to be a casual update to colleagues.

Subject: Re: 893 Alamuku Street, Haliimaile
Summary: The email is a personal message from Kate Symes to her mother, discussing a potential house move to Haliimaile. Kate encourages her mother to sell her current house and suggests ways she can assist, such as connecting her with friends for accommodation and rental car deals. The tone is supportive and informal.
This email is a personal message from Jeff Dasovich to colleagues, expressing appreciation for a social gathering at his residence the previous night.

Subject: Reminder - Annual Compliance Meeting
Summary: Donna Lowry reminds employees of the mandatory Annual Compliance Meeting on October 25, 2001, at the Doubletree Hotel, LaSalle Room B, from 8:30 am to 10:30 am. The agenda includes discussions on Board Seats, ECT Securities LP, Risk Management Policy, Chinese Wall Policy, Transaction Approval Process, and RAC Reporting Tools. Attendance is required, and participants are asked to RSVP to Donna Wackerle.

Subject: Enron Year End 2000 Performance Management Process
Summary: This email is a reminder from Enron's performance management team about the Year-End 2000 Performance Management Process. It instructs employees to access the Performance Evaluation Process (PEP) system to suggest reviewers for performance feedback, which must be completed by November 17th. The email also provides HelpDesk contact information for assistance during this process.

Subject: Conference - Mexico
Summary: Jaime Williams informs about an upcoming conference in Mexico, scheduled for the 19th in Monterrey and the 20th in Mexico City. The event aims to invite 550 customers, with an estimated attendance of 140 to 250 people. The budget for the conference, including room reservations, printed materials, translation, and cocktail events, is projected between $14,000 and $20,000, contingent on printed material needs. The venue is the Industrial's Club in both cities, and the agenda includes Jaime's request for approval to provide welcoming remarks.

Subject: Re: Merrick
Summary: Robert Walker is requesting specific details for the Merrick contract, including legal name, state of incorporation, physical address, contact information, scope of work, start date, and a contact name at Merrick.

Subject: Re: MMS meeting sheduled for Friday afternoon Feb 9th.
Summary: The email discusses scheduling a meeting on February 9th to address the MMS RFP process and statutory authority regarding royalty percentages, indicating an internal business operations matter.

Subject: Proposed Addition to Enfolio Firm General Terms & Conditions
Summary: This email discusses proposed changes to the Firm General Terms & Conditions (GTC) by Select, specifically focusing on credit assurances. The new clause outlines a process for one party to request performance assurance from the other if they deem the other's creditworthiness or performance unsatisfactory. Failure to provide the required assurance within three business days results in an Event of Default and triggers remedies as per Section 3 of the Firm GTC.

Subject: EIM Organization Change
Summary: Enron Industrial Markets (EIM) is expanding into Pulp, Paper, and Steel markets with a focus on Europe. Bruce Garner has been appointed as President and CEO of EIM - Europe to oversee all operations in the European market. Congratulations are extended to Bruce in his new role.

Subject: Institute of Americas Presentation - Brazil Energy Crisis
Summary: Jose Bestard, from Enron, is requesting Adriana to convert a presentation on the Brazil Energy Crisis into an Acrobat format and send it back. This email pertains to external communication, likely related to a presentation given at the Institute of Americas.
Kate Symes from Enron is requesting a call in the morning to clarify details regarding a deal involving a new counterparty, as she forgot to follow up on it during the day.

Subject: Please Tell us where to send your FREE watch!
Summary: This email is an unsolicited offer for a free watch from Intervolved.net, sent to dfarmer@ect.enopt.com. The recipient is informed that they have won a Caribbean Blue Exelo Gelly watch and is urged to claim it before supplies run out. The email includes images of the watch and a link to claim it, along with contact information for customer service. There's also an opt-out option and a disclaimer about privacy policy and resident restrictions.

Subject: RE: EES-CAL Book
Summary: Vladimir Gorny inquires about the EES-CAL book, noting discrepancies such as incorrect Nepool positions and missing VaR. He plans to rectify the issues on the same day.

Subject: Saturday
Summary: The email is a personal request from Darron Giron for directions and phone numbers, asking to be contacted at his home number on a Saturday.

Subject: Re: EB Location
Summary: The email discusses the need for Chris Germany's EB location to send the owner's manual for a drill, and a request to return a house key.

Subject: Re: Li Xiao
Summary: Molly Magee requests Vince Kaminski to write a recommendation letter for Li Xiao's graduate school tuition loan application. Vince confirms he will write the letter, and Molly thanks him for his assistance.

Subject: Viewing Electronic Pay Stubs
Summary: This email from no.address@enron.com informs employees about a new feature on eHRonline that allows viewing and printing of direct deposit advice starting November 15. It provides step-by-step instructions on how to access and print pay advice. Additionally, an Information Booth will be available from November 13 to 15 in the Enron North lobby for employees to learn more and see a demonstration.

Subject: University Affairs Contact List
Summary: Cindy provides a contact list for university affairs, noting it's incomplete and will be updated by Christie. Mike will supply phone numbers for specified universities. Cindy suggests leveraging existing personal relationships with faculty and deans due to Enron's damaged credibility.

Subject: Re:
Summary: Sandra Brawner is responding to a previous message, expressing her willingness to assist with an unspecified matter.

Subject: Re: Doctoral studies
Summary: Rob Wilson, a Regional Manager of Government Affairs at NNG in Omaha, is initiating doctoral studies in regulatory politics with a focus on energy and telecom market convergence. He is seeking advice from Vince Kaminski regarding potential research areas based on Kaminski's industry experience. The email discusses forming a supervisory committee and curriculum of study.

Subject: PG&E/Transwestern Gas Quality Meeting

The agenda includes an item of concern regarding a financial problem of Transwestern's parent company. Additionally, Rod has attached the latest budget information for 2001 and plans to send 2002 projections on Monday. There will be five attendees, with only Rod interested in golf.

The itinerary specifies non-stop flights with Continental Airlines, accommodation at The Drake hotel, and a negotiated discount fare. It includes essential traveler information and contact details.

Subject: Petrochem Desk
Summary: Vince Kaminski inquires about Kate's involvement in a project, possibly related to the Petrochem Desk. Nelson Neale informs Vince that Christian LeBroc, formerly from RAC, has joined the Petrochem Desk as a trader. The Petrochem group lacks a solid forward curve due to reliance on intuition, and Nelson suggests it would take 6-8 weeks to develop one, starting with a relationship between petrochemicals and NYMEX components like crude oil.

Subject: George Phillips

Subject: Politicians seek shelter as energy Armageddon looms
Summary: The email discusses the ongoing energy crisis in California, focusing on the political response and lack of effective solutions. It highlights the governor's efforts, the failure of long-term supply contracts, and the reluctance of Wall Street to invest due to uncertainty. The crisis is worsening, with the possibility of summer blackouts and utility bankruptcies, prompting politicians to distance themselves from the issue and focus on self-preservation.

Subject: Re: FX Issues
Summary: The email discusses a legal and tax issue regarding foreign exchange (FX) transactions, specifically identifying the principal and agent for tax purposes. It also touches on the classification of FX transactions as financial products and the implications for internal product types and potential external offerings. Additionally, there's a technology issue concerning the creation of deal and product types for FX index products within Enron's systems.

The purpose is to align efforts, review proposals from Enron Wind and ENA, and strategize on switching commodity providers from Reliant to EES. The goal is to create a win-win economic and messaging opportunity, aiming for an Earth Day announcement.

Starting October 26, Transco will reduce the tolerance for negatively scheduled imbalances at pooling points from 4% to 1% or 1,000 dts. Questions should be directed to Terry Fitch or John McGrath.

Subject: ABX2 2 - Windfall Profits
Summary: The email discusses the progress of bill ABX2 2 (Corbett) in the Assembly Appropriations Committee, which has been placed on the Suspense File due to its projected fiscal impact exceeding $150,000. The bill will be debated privately and voted on publicly on May 31. Considered amendments include exempting co-generation, new power plants, existing long-term contracts, and raising the price from $60 to $100.

Subject: Re: Annual Election of Officers
Summary: The email discusses the annual election of officers for EOTT Energy Corp. at the May Board of Directors meeting, with a draft resolution for the reelection of the current slate of officers attached. The sender, Walter Zimmerman, requests feedback on the proposed officer slate before including it in the board materials.

Subject: Natural Gas Origination
Summary: The email discusses internal restructuring within Enron's natural gas business. The Producer/Wellhead Group will consolidate mid-market, origination, and wellhead pricing activities in the Central and Eastern Gas Regions under Fred Lagrasta. Laura Luce will lead strategic asset development in the Central and Eastern Regions, while Frank Vickers will take on leadership for Mid-Market and Origination in the Central Region. No changes are made to the West and Texas Origination groups.

Summary: The email pertains to March 2001 nominations for gas delivery to Shell Deer Park, specifying firm baseload and spot swing supply quantities, along with expected delivery details via HPL pipelines. It also mentions that turnaround activities started in January are expected to conclude in the second half of March.

Subject: California Update--08.27.01
Summary: Jeff Dasovich from Enron provides an update on California's PUC and legislative changes affecting Direct Access and rate agreements. The update details amendments to the proposal regarding customer exemptions for Direct Access, including those with consistent contracts since May 2000, self-generation users, and exemption limits. It also mentions the Assembly version of SB 78's scheduled committee review and voting on August 27, 2001, with Direct Access suspension set to begin 90 days after the bill's signing.

Subject: Re: Your Invitation to Enron's Executive Forum - 1st Quarter 2001
Summary: Jeffrey Hodge is responding to an invitation for Enron's Executive Forum, expressing his preference for March 30 and March 29, both scheduled for 2:30-4:00 PM in EB50M. The forum is designed for past participants of the Executive Impact and Influence Program to share opinions, ask questions, and discuss various topics with the Office of the Chairman. RSVP is required by March 16, 2001.

Subject: For Discussion: Implementing Definition of Trading Office
Summary: The email discusses the implementation of a definition for a trading office, focusing on the buying and selling of physical commodities locally versus hedging with a regional hub. It also explores the agency model where local traders act under hub direction and suggests the possibility of independent Risk Managers in each office with all correspondence and settlements handled by the regional hub.

Subject: GE
Summary: Scott Dieball shares the latest markup on warranty language being reviewed by GE, mentions comments from John Rigby to consider later, and notes that Steve Swift will email Sheila Tweed about agreed-upon indemnity terms for the Arcos contract. Kay Mann is copied in the communication.

Subject: Prepared Testimony in I.99-07-003
Summary: Susan Scott from Transwestern Pipeline Company is sending the Prepared Direct Testimony of Jeffery C. Fawcett in support of a Comprehensive Settlement Agreement, designated as Exhibit 12, to Judge Biren. The testimony was also delivered in hard copy on May 5, and Susan requests confirmation if there are issues with the electronic version.

Subject: URGENT! Join the Bush "SWAT" Team
Summary: Tony Garza from onr.com is recruiting volunteers to join the Bush campaign's "SWAT" team for voter turnout efforts in key battleground states during the final weeks of the election. Interested individuals are asked to provide travel details and availability.

Subject: Archive Log for 7/10/2001 2:43:30 PM
Summary: This email pertains to an archive log for Enron Metals Re-Branding project, including various documents created by different Enron employees between September 2000 and July 2001, likely for project coordination and tracking purposes.

Subject: t,h: Eyeforenergy Update
Summary: This email is an update from Eyeforenergy, detailing recent energy industry news and upcoming conferences. It includes information on events like The Business of Fuel Cells for Transportation in Detroit, Emissions Trading 2002 in Amsterdam, and Weather Trading 2002 in Amsterdam. The email also mentions recent headlines such as Enron's situation and AEP's venture into renewable energy, aimed at keeping recipients informed about the energy sector.

Subject: Revised Term Sheet!!!!
Summary: This email chain discusses a revised term sheet, indicating financial negotiations or contract adjustments, with multiple parties from Enron and an external party from Credit Suisse First Boston. The email contains an attachment labeled "Swap_Jun_27_00.doc," likely pertaining to the revised terms.

Subject: daily crude & ngas charts 11/6
Summary: Scott Oblander from Carr Futures is sharing daily crude and natural gas charts, along with various spread and matrix documents, via email links. He offers to send the charts as attachments if the recipient cannot access them online. The email includes disclaimers about the accuracy and completeness of the information provided.

Subject:
RE: Comments of the Other Parties on El Paso System Reallocation,
 RP00-336
Summary: This email pertains to a regulatory proceeding (RP00-336) regarding the El Paso System Reallocation, involving comments from other parties. The sender has compiled these comments into an attached document, now arranged alphabetically, with recent additions highlighted. The email seeks confirmation on whether the recipient needs copies of specific comments.

Subject: WTI models
Summary: Zimin Lu has finalized the presentation for John Lavorato, who is ready to present it to Greg. Zimin will be on vacation starting next week and has attached simulation models for open-close and continuous trading. Zimin offers to answer any questions via home contact or upon return next year.

Subject: Re: A little bit of heaven
Summary: Robin Rodrigue from Enron shares a light-hearted email about Krispy Kreme doughnuts delivered at work, mentions covering a night shift, and jokes about Christmas shopping for her mother. The email also includes a humorous observation about political protests.
Ben Rogers has sent an updated deal sheet for the GTD group, likely containing project-related information or progress updates.

Subject: Software license
Summary: Helyette Geman apologizes for delayed response due to a 6-week trip to the US. She confirms agreement on a software license price of $90,000, with payment options in three fractions. System support will be provided via email and phone, though unlimited support cannot be guaranteed. The current law firm for escrow is Hart, Reed, Brown, Golowich and Kaplan in Amherst, but they are open to alternative solutions.

Subject: Re: Revised Restated Plan Docucments; 1 of 2
Summary: Pat from AOL.com is following up on the revised restated plan documents, emphasizing the need to determine which documents to execute based on an upcoming decision by the Office of the Chair. The execution of one document dated Nov 18 is urged, and a note is given to Chris Rahaim about incorporating revised claims procedure provisions in the restated document for the December board meeting.

Subject: NUI
Summary: Tanya from Enron is updating on a financial transaction involving NUI Utilities, Inc. The $50MM NUI Corp guarantee is no longer needed, but a financial swap under NUI Energy Brokers, Inc. ISDA is being documented. Adjustments are required in the Transaction Agreement and financial confirmation to reflect NUI as the Guarantor, not NUI Capital, and a deal-specific guarantee of $10MM from NUI Utilities is planned.

Subject: Goldendale
Summary: Delainey seeks assistance for a project in the Florida market, specifically requesting consideration of transferring GE 7FA turbines from Goldendale. The Florida project is valued at up to $40,000,000 and requires a commitment by December when the customer is expected to finalize contracts. Delainey asks for a comparison of potential earnings from both projects, highlighting the Florida market's potential for Enron.

Subject: Company Wide Email
Summary: This email announces changes in the government and regulatory affairs organization at Enron. Rick Shapiro becomes Managing Director of Government Affairs for North and South America, while Mark Schroeder takes on additional responsibility for the APACHI and India organizations. Mike Terraso is appointed as Vice President of Environment, Health & Safety and Chief Environmental Officer, and John Hardy continues as Vice President Global Project Finance, reporting directly to the sender. An attached organizational chart reflects these changes.

Subject: Managers Training
Summary:
Enron's EWS Development Center is hosting a leadership training program titled "The Managers Level Impact and Influence Program" on June 14th and 15th from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. at the Double Tree Hotel Down Town. The cost is $1,500, and CPE credits are available. The workshop aims to equip managers with innovative leadership skills, focusing on topics like leadership credibility, strategic thinking, managing change, directing others, leading teams, and influencing others.

(Note: Although this email involves internal training, it primarily focuses on enhancing operational efficiency through leadership development, making it fit best within Business Operations & Logistics.)

Subject: Your News Alert for CMGI
Summary: This email is a news alert from EquityAlert.com regarding a Form 144 filing by David Denebeim to sell 538 shares of CMGI Inc. on November 2, 2001. The alert includes details such as the transaction date, shares for sale, value held, broker, and stock information. It also contains a disclaimer stating that EquityAlert.com is a financial news re-distributor and not an investment advisory service.

Subject: FW: how is this for subliminable?
Summary: This email contains a forwarded message with a humorous, politically-tinged joke about rearranging the letters of "Republican National Committee" to form a critical statement about the 2000 US presidential election. The original message includes an image attachment.

Subject: C-Gas
Summary: David Delainey is requesting a reasonable offer for the C-Gas asset from Steve, asking for an economic rationale as discussed earlier.

Subject: FW: Concerns with Status of Enron Integration Testing
Summary: Chris Edmonds forwards concerns from Maria O'Neill at Enform regarding delays in Enron Integration testing since January 17th. The issues involve incorrect price postings and missing spaces in data received, with Enron's Operations group unable to assist due to other commitments. Maria suggests having an Enron representative on-site for better communication and quicker issue resolution, alongside prioritized support from Enron's developer and products groups. Chris seeks feedback from Andy to address these concerns and expedite the testing process.

Subject: My gratitude
Summary: The email is from a candidate expressing gratitude for an interview opportunity with Enron, acknowledging the company's excellent working environment, and awaiting further news from the research group. The candidate offers to take additional steps to expedite the hiring process.

Subject: (00-387) Termination of Members Retention and Retirement Plan
Summary: This email from exchangeinfo@nymex.com announces the termination of the New York Mercantile Exchange Members Retention and Retirement Plan. The Board of Directors voted to terminate the plan, contingent on receiving a satisfactory Private Letter Ruling from the IRS. Following member concerns about the discount rate used, a special committee was formed to review and decide on the appropriate discount rate, eventually settling on 8.0%. The email details the distribution of assets to Qualified Participants and those with 10-14 years of Continuous Service, with payouts anticipated in mid-January 2001. It also clarifies that neither the original nor amended Plan allows for member votes on amendments and refutes inaccurate claims about discount rates used in lump-sum payments.

Subject:
Re: recommendation of an outstanding Baylor MBA student for summer
 internship
Summary: Jim Garven, a professor at Baylor University, recommends Rusty Parks, an MBA student, for a summer internship at Enron. Garven highlights Rusty's impressive work ethic and interest in financial engineering and technology, particularly in the energy sector. Garven notes that Rusty is scheduled for an interview on April 19 with Althea Gordon at Enron and attaches Rusty's resume for consideration.

Subject: Re: Deal # 457397
Summary: Kate Symes from Enron confirms that the delivery point for Deal #457397 was altered but the energy remained unchanged; it involves CAISO energy.

Subject: Re: amerex so far
Summary: The email discusses changes in brokered trades involving Amerex, specifying details like strike prices, expiry times, and counterparties. It mentions adjustments to trades with IDs 505434, 505066, and 505313, indicating logistical or operational updates within energy trading activities at Enron.

Subject: Associate and Analyst Program Contacts
Summary: This email provides contact information for various personnel involved in the Associate and Analyst Programs at Enron, including their roles, extensions, and email addresses, across different global offices. It appears to be an internal communication for HR or program administration purposes.

Subject: Re: New power company
Summary: The email exchange pertains to a power company deal, with Darla acknowledging a mistake in drafting demand charges and Chris accepting responsibility for the oversight, indicating a discussion on correcting or finalizing a business deal.

Subject: Re: I am stuck
Summary: The email is from robin.rodrigue@enron.com, suggesting an internal company matter, possibly related to HR or staff support, as indicated by the subject "I am stuck" and the inquiry "Any hope yet?".

Subject: Re: Phillip
Summary: Tori Kuykendall suggests maintaining a consistent policy of not giving birthday gifts to avoid setting a precedent, focusing instead on celebrating Boss's Day annually.

Subject: Mid-Year 2000 Performance Feedback
Summary: This email is a reminder for selected Enron employees to provide performance feedback on specific employees via the Performance Management System (PEP) by the due date of June 16, 2000. It includes a list of employees needing feedback, their supervisors, and the dates they were selected. Contact information for assistance with PEP is also provided.

Subject: GD-NEW
Summary: Darron Giron requests the addition of Eric Moon to the user list for the Canadian Logic On/Off script.

Subject: Re: Update - Proposed Alberta Power Pool Rule Changes
Summary: Robert Hemstock updates Richard Shapiro on the proposed Alberta Power Pool rule changes. The Power Pool will not proceed with a rule to exclude importers from setting pool price but will implement dispatch risk rule changes. Enron's input on these changes is positive, and a meeting with the Minister of Resource Development is scheduled for December 11 to discuss the matter further. An updated "Lessons from other Jurisdictions" document will be finalized and shared with the Alberta Government and Power Pool.

Subject: Re: THE GARTMAN LETTER; FRIDAY, OCTOBER 6, 2000
Summary: The email discusses coordinating a group for focusing on new business ventures, with a mention of needing extra spots for team members and optimizing resources for each business.

Subject: Re: Voyage Orders
Summary: Dan Masters is discussing voyage orders with Wayne Perry, focusing on cargo saturation pressure limits and heeling decisions. The maximum cargo saturation pressure is debated, with suggestions ranging from 1100mb to 1160mb, considering minimizing boil-off and potential delays. The decision on heeling out (running bunkers on the ballast voyage) is postponed until closer to the discharge date to factor in possible delays and bunker prices.

Subject: N.O.V. Updates
Summary: The email from team.san-juan-laplata@enron.com with the subject "N.O.V. Updates" provides recent updates, likely concerning project or operational details, given its business-oriented focus.
